metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3164 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The authentication setup in XWayland 1.16.x and 1.17.x before 1.17.2 starts the server in non-authenticating mode, which allows local users to read from or send information to arbitrary X11 clients via vectors involving a UNIX socket.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3164` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.2
xdmx-tools - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.2
xmir - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.2
xnest - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.2
xorg-server-source - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.2
xserver-common - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.2
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.2
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.2
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.2
xserver-xorg-xmir - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.2
xvfb - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.2
xwayland - 2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:1.18.4-0ubuntu0.2').
